_prev_prog_2.Description:
THE UTE WATER CONSERVANCY DISTRICT?S CHLORINE LEAK PREVENTION PROGRAM CONSISTS OF THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS:

1. CHLORINE LEAK DETECTION MONITOR
2. MONTHLY SERVICE AND CALIBRATION OF LEAK DETECTION MONITOR
3. VISUAL AND AUDIO ALARMS WHICH ARE TRIGGERED BY THE LEAK  DETECTION EQUIPMENT
4. PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE PROGRAM FOR CHLORINE FEED EQUIPMENT, CHLORINE CONTAINER SWITCH OVER DEVICE, CHLORINE SCALES,  AND INDIVIDUAL CHEMICAL SPECIFIC RESPIRATORS, AND THE LOADING / UNLOADING CRANE. THIS PROGRAM IS CARRIED OUT ON A MONTHLY BASIS.
5. CONTAINMENT OF CHLORINE LEAK IN THE ENCLOSED CHLORINE STORAGE / FEED ROOM
6. THE CHLORINE STORAGE / FEED ROOM CAN ONLY BE ENTERED FROM THE OUTSIDE, AND IS ISOLATED FROM THE OTHER STRUCTURES AT THE TREATMENT PLANT.
7. ENTRY DOORS ARE EQUIPPED WITH PANIC HARDWARE, OPEN TO THE OUTSIDE, AND HAVE SHATTER PROOF GLASS WINDOWS.
8. THE CHLORINE STORAGE / FEED ROOM IS WELL LIGHTED, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED, AND EQUIPPED WITH A VENTILATION SYSTEM WHICH CAN BE OPERATED AUTOMATICALLY OR MANUALLY. 
9. ESTABLISHED WRITTEN PROCEDURES FOR CONNECTING AND DISCONNECTING ONE TON CHLORINE CONTAINERS.
10. ESTABLISHED WRITTEN PROCEDURES FOR LOADING AND UNLOADING ONE TON CHLORINE CONTAINERS
11. ANNUAL  TRAINING FOR ALL TREATMENT PLANT PERSONNEL. THE TRAINING INCLUDES:
? THE USE OF RESPIRATORS 
? THE HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH CHLORINE GAS
? THE SAFE HANDLING OF ONE TON CHLORINE CONTAINERS
? HOW TO USE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS ( MSDS )
? EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROCEDURES 

12. SIGNAGE IS POSTED AT THE ENTRY DOORS TO THE CHLORINE STORAGE / FEED ROOM. THE SIGNS STATE - POISONOUS GAS KEEP OUT CHLORINE AUTHORISED PERSONNEL ONLY.

THE CHLORINE LEAK PREVETION PLAN IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY  AND UPDATE AS NEEDED

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE UTE WATER CONSERVANCY DISTRICT'S  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PLAN INCORPORATES TECHNOLOGIES, PROCEDURES, AND MANAGEMENT PRACTICES GEARED TOWARDS REDUCING THE PROBABILITY OF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF CHLORINE GAS.  ALL  APPLICABLE PROCEDURES OF THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY PREVENTION PROGRAM HAVE BEEN ADHERED TO. THE UTE WATER TREATMENT PLANT'S  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN IS TAILORED TO THE OPERATIONAL PRACTICES OF THE DISTRICT'S TREATMENT PLANT AND THOSE OF THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE SERVICES AVAILABLE IN THE COMMUNITY, AND IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH EPA'S EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS.

THE UTE WATER TREATMENT PLANT PROVIDES OVER 60 %  OF THE DOMESTIC AND FIRE FIGHTING WATER TO URBAN AND RURAL AREAS OF THE GREATER GRAND VALLEY, WITH OVER 900 MILES OF FINISHED WATER DISTRIBUTION PIPELINES.  THE FULL CONVENTIONAL TREATMENT PLANT UTILIZES CHLORINE GAS FOR DISINFECTION.  THE CHLORINE STORAGE ROOM IS ISOLATED FROM THE FACILITY AND STORES A MAXIMUM OF EIGHT ( 8 ) ONE TON CONTAINERS OF LIQUID CHLORINE AT ANY GIVEN TIME. THE CHLORINE STORAGE ROOM IS EQUIPPED WITH, CHLORINATORS, A LEAK DETECTOR WITH AUDIO AND VISUAL ALARMS,  VARIOUS SAFETY EQUIPMENT, ELECTRIC PANELS, AND INSTRUMENTATION.  THE  TREATMENT PLANT IS MANNED 24 HOURS A DAY BY CERTIFIED OPERATORS.

ACTIVE MITIGATION MEASURES WHICH ARE IN AFFECT INCLUDE:

? CHLORINE LEAK DETECTION EQUIPMENT WITH AUDIO AND VISUAL ALARMS
? VACUUM TYPE CHLORINATORS AND CHLORINE GAS PIPING 
? LEAK CONTAINMENT WITHIN THE CHLORINE STORAGE BUILDING
? ABILITY TO PROVIDE NEGATIVE PRESSURE WITHIN THE CHLORINE STORAGE BUILDING
 

THE UTE WATER TREATMENT PLANTS ACCIDENTAL CHLORINE RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM IS BASED ON THE FOLLOWING KEY ELEMENTS:

? OPERATOR AND SUPERVISORY TRAINING
? AN ONGOING PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE PROGRAM
? THE USE OF STATE OF THE ART PROCESS AND SAFETY EQUIPMENT
? THE CREATION AND USE OF ACCURATE AND EFFICIENT OPERATING PROCEDURES, DEVELOPED AND WRITTEN WITH THE FULL PARTICIPATION OF THE OPERATORS AND ST

AFF AT THE DISTRICT'S TREATMENT PLANT 
? IMPLEMENTATION OF AN AUDITING AND INSPECTION PROGRAM WHICH INCLUDES A HAZARD REVIEW OF EQUIPMENT AND PROCEDURES

OPERATOR SAFETY MEASURES FOR HANDLING CHLORINE INCLUDE:

? INDIVIDUAL CHEMICAL SPECIFIC RESPIRATORS WORN BY BOTH OPERATORS DURING CONNECTION AND/OR  DISCONNECTION OF CHLORINE CONTAINERS AND MAINTENANCE OF CHLORINE FEED EQUIPMENT
? ON-GOING OPERATOR TRAINING AND SET PROCEDURES FOR HANDLING CHLORINE  CONTAINERS  AND RELATED EQUIPMENT

RMP*COMP MODELING WAS USED TO PERFORM THE WORST CASE AND ALTERNATE WORST CASE OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSES FOR A CHLORINE RELEASE. 
 
THERE HAS BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF CHLORINE SINCE THE PLANT WAS INITIALLY PUT INTO SERVICE IN 1964. THE DISTRICT'S TREATMENT PLANT HAS AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN, WHICH HAS BEEN REVIEWED AND COORDINATED WITH THE GRAND JUNCTION FIRE DEPARTMENT?S HAZ-MAT TEAM  AND THE MESA COUNTY LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLANNING COMMITTEE. THE PLAN IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY, AND UPDATED AS NEEDED.
